channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Live Covid-19 updates for Monday 17 August
item.description: Auckland Mayor Phil Goff says it's not wise for people to flout the level 3 rules and put themselves and others at risk. Follow our blog for the latest updates.

item.title: Covid-19: Social media in the spotlight after misinformation
item.description: Nasty rumours, inaccurate advice and bullying has circulated through social media following the second wave of infections.

item.title: Kiwis encouraged to buy or make their own face masks
item.description: New Zealand's new advisory on masks is encouraging people to buy or make their own in order to help reduce spreading the virus.

item.title: The real cost of community funding from pokies
item.description: The Detail - Much of the problem gambling issue stems from pokie machines - the same machines that prop up a myriad of community groups.

item.title: Auckland elective surgeries postponed due to Covid-19 outbreak
item.description: Doctors' appointments and elective surgeries are being postponed across Auckland this week because of Covid-19.

item.title: Covid-19 updates for Sunday 16 August
item.description: New Zealand First joins other parties in seeking a new election date; a harmful claim is being circulated about a woman with Covid-19 and a record number of tests is being carried out.

item.title: Hearing loss communities: 'We are still asking to be listened to'
item.description: People with hearing loss could be discriminated and have their needs overlooked in the government's response to the Covid-19 pandemic, say advocates.

item.title: Thirteen new confirmed cases of Covid-19 in NZ, three people in hospital
item.description: There are 12 new community cases of Covid-19, all in Auckland and all connected to existing cases, with one new case in managed isolation. Watch the latest media conference here.

item.title: Festival director targets full cinema experience for 2021
item.description: The International Film Festival director hopes there will not be another festival that's a mix of cinema and online experiences.

item.title: Fewer than 50,000 foreign students remain in New Zealand
item.description: In mid-March, there were 60,348 students with valid visas in New Zealand, but by early August that had fallen to 47,807.

item.title: Police investigate shooting in South Auckland
item.description: The police are reassuring people that a firearm incident in Auckland early this morning isn't random.

item.title: Push for aged care staff to be tested on site
item.description: The Aged Care Association is calling for Covid-19 tests to be made available for staff in rest homes.

item.title: $50m Lotto results revealed after unusually long delay
item.description: The prize results for last night's $50m Lotto draw have finally been released after an unusually long delay, with the jackpot to be shared by 10 winners who had second division tickets.

item.title: Capital violence: Combined effort aims to reduce problems in Wellington's entertainment district
item.description: Wellington City Council, businesses and the police are working together to stem recent spates of violence in the city's entertainment district.

item.title: Family care payments bungled but government won't back pay them
item.description: The government bungled changes to payments for family carers, and is refusing to back pay them.

item.title: Canterbury District Health Board faces fifth high level resignation since last month
item.description: The Canterbury District Health Board's chief medical officer is the fifth high-level resignation from the board's executive team since last month.

item.title: Covid-19: Cabinet to decide future of alert levels, decision to be announced at 5.30pm
item.description: Cabinet will this afternoon decide whether to extend the lockdown to quash the Covid-19 cluster. PM Jacinda Ardern will announce the decision at 5.30pm.

item.title: Christchurch attack victims, family members from overseas in managed isolation before gunman's sentencing
item.description: More than 50 people are in managed isolation at New Zealand's border facilities so they can attend the sentencing of the Christchurch gunman in person.
